en.title: Global Mechanism of Real Value Loss
en.subtitle: Three-Dimensional Analytical Study (1970 - 2025)
en.tagline: A systematic analysis revealing the transfer of real value (measured in gold) from individuals to the dominant financial system through three interconnected indicators
en.chart_income_label: US Individual Daily Income (Gold Grams/Day Ã· 10)
en.footer: Developed in collaboration with AI tools for research and scientific purposes
en.indicator_1_desc: Loss of real purchasing power of a barrel of oil when measured by the constant gold standard since 1970.
en.indicator_2_title: Collapse of US Individual Real Income
en.indicator_2_desc: Collapse of the purchasing power of individual income in the US when valued in gold.
en.indicator_2_note: * Divided by 10 for visual display purposes only
en.indicator_3_desc: Rise in nominal oil price in compressed dollars, hiding the erosion of the currency's real value.
en.legend_income: US Individual Daily Income (Gold Grams/Day Ã· 10)
en.legend_note: ğŸ’¡ Note on US Income Scale: US individual daily income values were divided by 10 for visual display purposes only, to unify the value range with the oil value indicator. This adjustment does not change the percentage change (which remains -97.9%) nor affect the relative trend analysis.
en.ai_collab_text: The analytical mathematical model and three-dimensional methodology were developed in collaboration with the Gemini AI assistant, focusing on:
en.ai_collab_point1: Building the Integrated Methodological Framework (CDD Model)
en.ai_collab_point2: Analyzing mathematical relationships between the three indicators
en.ai_collab_point3: Developing the Total Value Impact Model (TVI Model)
en.ai_collab_point4: Formulating the scientific explanation for the value transfer mechanism
en.ai_collab_note: The tool's role was in 'methodological analysis and mathematical model synthesis, not in generating primary data'.
en.table1_note1: Historical Oil Prices: U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA)
en.table1_note2: Historical Gold Prices: World Gold Council, FRED Economic Data
en.table1_note3: US National Income Data: U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA)
en.table1_note4: Income Calculation in Gold: (Income in USD Ã· Gold Ounce Price) Ã— 31.1035 grams
en.table2_note1: Adjusted Daily Income = (Actual Daily Income Ã· 10) for visual display purposes
en.table2_note2: Income to Oil Ratio = (Daily Income Ã· Oil Value) Ã— (100 Ã· 1970 Ratio)
en.table2_note3: Compressed Nominal Price = Oil Price in USD Ã· 100 (to unify visual range)
en.table3_note1: Relative Change = ((Final Value - Initial Value) Ã· Initial Value) Ã— 100%
en.table3_note2: Average Annual Change = ((Final Value Ã· Initial Value)^(1/Number of Years) - 1) Ã— 100%
en.methodology_point1: Gold Standard: Using gold as a constant value standard over time to measure real purchasing power.
en.methodology_point2: Three-Dimensional Model: Analyzing the relationship between natural resource value erosion, real individual income collapse, and nominal value inflation.
en.methodology_point3: Visual Scale Unification: Adjusting display scales (like dividing income by 10) for visual illustration purposes without affecting mathematical ratios.
en.methodology_point4: Relative Analysis: Focusing on change trends and percentages rather than isolated absolute values.
en.footer_title: Global Mechanism of Real Value Loss Study
en.footer_desc: A systematic three-dimensional analysis based on real data and verifiable scientific methodology
en.copyright: Â© 2025 - All rights reserved. This is a scientific analytical study open for discussion and development.
en.footer_note: The analytical methodology was developed in collaboration with AI tools for research and scientific purposes.
en.conclusions_subtitle: The Truth of Entity X and Value Loss Capitalization Mechanism
en.conclusion_1_text: Where did the 198% gap between GDP growth and wages go? It was absorbed through three channels:
en.conclusion_1_point1: ğŸ¤– Automation: Reducing labor share in favor of capital.
en.conclusion_1_point2: ğŸ’¸ Financialization: Inflation of asset prices and debts.
en.conclusion_1_point3: âš”ï¸ Conflict Economy: Financing dominance through debt.
en.conclusion_2_text: The study proved a simultaneous loss for both parties:
en.conclusion_2_point1: ğŸ“‰ External Loss: Oil states lost 72.9% of the developmental value of the barrel.
en.conclusion_2_point2: ğŸ“‰ Internal Loss: The US individual lost 98.6% of the purchasing power of their wage in gold.
en.conclusion_3_text: It is not just a theory, but a 'capitalized economic mechanism' acting as a value transformer, converting real wealth into financial dominance, benefiting from monetary inflation globally and wage stagnation locally.
